name: Telescope Words A-Z Quiz Series - U and V | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.text:
Telescope words are words that, when the first letter is taken away, creates another word, and when the first letter of that word is taken away, you get yet another word.  For instance, if the clue reads "Beverage - Skating arena - Pen fluid", the answer is "Drink", because Drink - D = Rink, and Rink - R = Ink.  For this particular quiz, all answers start with U or V.

The first five answers will start with U.

One part - Louse egg - That thing
Standing something on its end - Awaiting - Stopping
Employing - Make mouth music - Meadow, or a suffix at the end of a verb
Someone who shows people to their seats - Klezmer folk music dance - Not him

The remaining five answers will start with a V.

This one has four clues!

Throw up - Leave out - Prefix meaning thread - That thing
Field mouse - Spanish expression of victory - French article

Another with four clues!

Type of parking - French river - Allow - He phones home
Turn - Poetic "ever" - Interjection to show hesitation or suffix meaning the person who does something

This one might be a bit tricky.  Good luck!

It, too, has four clues.

Evening church service - Humans with telepathic abilities - Ancient Georgian principalities - Grayish blue
